quote: In theory, there is no difference between theory and practice, while in practice there is.
author: Benjamin Brewster, Yale Literary Magazine

quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
author: Martin Fowler

quote: Software engineering is what happens to programming when you add time and other programmers.
author: Russ Cox

quote: Design is the art of arranging code to work today, and be changeable forever.
author: Sandi Metz

quote: Poor naming is symptomatic of poor design.
author: Dave Cheney

quote: Good naming is like a good joke. If you have to explain it, it’s not funny.
author: Dave Cheney

quote: The greater the distance between a name’s declaration and its uses, the longer the name should be.
author: Andrew Gerrand

quote: Good code has lots of comments, bad code requires lots of comments.
author: Dave Thomas and Andrew Hunt, The Pragmatic Programmer

quote: [A little] duplication is far cheaper than the wrong abstraction.
author: Sandy Metz
